#> [[9]]
#> [1] "protocol of 2003 to the international convention on the establishment of an international fund for compensation for oil pollution damage, 1992\nsource: http://www.austlii.edu.au/au/other/dfat/treaties/notinforce/2005/21.html\nthe contracting states to the present protocol,\nbearing in mind the international convention on civil liability for oil pollution damage, 1992 (hereinafter \"the 1992 liability convention\"),\nhaving considered the international convention on the establishment of an international fund for compensation for oil pollution damage, 1992 (hereinafter \"the 1992 fund convention\"),\naffirming the importance of maintaining the viability of the international oil pollution liability and compensation system,\nnoting that the maximum compensation afforded by the 1992 fund convention might be insufficient to meet compensation needs in certain circumstances in some contracting states to that convention,\nrecognizing that a number of contracting states to the 1992 liability and 1992 fund conventions consider it necessary as a matter of urgency to make available additional funds for compensation through the creation of a supplementary scheme to which states may accede if they so wish,\nbelieving that the supplementary scheme should seek to ensure that victims of oil pollution damage are compensated in full for their loss or damage and should also alleviate the difficulties faced by victims in cases where there is a risk that the amount of compensation available under the 1992 liability and 1992 fund conventions will be insufficient to pay established claims in full and that as a consequence the international oil pollution compensation fund, 1992, has decided provisionally that it will pay only a proportion of any established claim,\nconsidering that accession to the supplementary scheme will be open only to contracting states to the 1992 fund convention,\nhave agreed as follows:\ngeneral provisions"
#> [2] "19\nsignature, ratification, acceptance, approval and accession\n1 this protocol shall be open for signature at london from 31 july 2003 to 30 july 2004.\n2 states may express their consent to be bound by this protocol by:\n(a) signature without reservation as to ratification, acceptance or approval; or\n(b) signature subject to ratification, acceptance or approval followed by ratification, acceptance or approval; or\n(c) accession.\n3 only contracting states to the 1992 fund convention may become contracting states to this protocol.\n4 ratification, acceptance, approval or accession shall be effected by the deposit of a formal instrument to that effect with the secretary-general."

#> [1] "24\namendment of compensation limit\n1 upon the request of at least one quarter of the contracting states, any proposal to amend the limit of the amount of compensation laid down in article 4, paragraph 2 (a), shall be circulated by the secretary-general to all members of the organization and to all contracting states.\n2 any amendment proposed and circulated as above shall be submitted to the legal committee of the organization for consideration at a date at least six months after the date of its circulation.\n3 all contracting states to this protocol, whether or not members of the organization, shall be entitled to participate in the proceedings of the legal committee for the consideration and adoption of amendments.\n4 amendments shall be adopted by a two-thirds majority of the contracting states present and voting in the legal committee, expanded as provided for in paragraph 3, on condition that at least one half of the contracting states shall be present at the time of voting.\n5 when acting on a proposal to amend the limit, the legal committee shall take into account the experience of incidents and in particular the amount of damage resulting therefrom and changes in the monetary values.\n6 (a) no amendments of the limit under this article may be considered before the date of entry into force of this protocol nor less than three years from the date of entry into force of a previous amendment under this article.\n(b) the limit may not be increased so as to exceed an amount which corresponds to the limit laid down in this protocol increased by six per cent per year calculated on a compound basis from the date when this protocol is opened for signature to the date on which the legal committee's decision comes into force.\n(c) the limit may not be increased so as to exceed an amount which corresponds to the limit laid down in this protocol multiplied by three.\n7 any amendment adopted in accordance with paragraph 4 shall be notified by the organization to all contracting states. the amendment shall be deemed to have been accepted at the end of a period of twelve months after the date of notification, unless within that period not less than one quarter of the states that were contracting states at the time of the adoption of the amendment by the legal committee have communicated to the organization that they do not accept the amendment, in which case the amendment is rejected and shall have no effect.\n8 an amendment deemed to have been accepted in accordance with paragraph 7 shall enter into force twelve months after its acceptance.\n9 all contracting states shall be bound by the amendment, unless they denounce this protocol in accordance with article 26, paragraphs 1 and 2, at least six months before the amendment enters into force. such denunciation shall take effect when the amendment enters into force.\n10 when an amendment has been adopted by the legal committee but the twelve-month period for its acceptance has not yet expired, a state which becomes a contracting state during that period shall be bound by the amendment if it enters into force. a state which becomes a contracting state after that period shall be bound by an amendment which has been accepted in accordance with paragraph 7 . in the cases referred to in this paragraph, a state becomes bound by an amendment when that amendment enters into force, or when this protocol enters into force for that state, if later."
#> [2] "26\ndenunciation\n1 this protocol may be denounced by any contracting state at any time after the date on which it enters into force for that contracting state.\n2 denunciation shall be effected by the deposit of an instrument with the secretary-general.\n3 a denunciation shall take effect twelve months, or such longer period as may be specified in the instrument of denunciation, after its deposit with the secretary-general.\n4 denunciation of the 1992 fund convention shall be deemed to be a denunciation of this protocol. such denunciation shall take effect on the date on which denunciation of the protocol of 1992 to amend the 1971 fund convention takes effect according to article 34 of that protocol.\n5 notwithstanding a denunciation of the present protocol by a contracting state pursuant to this article, any provisions of this protocol relating to the obligations to make contributions to the supplementary fund with respect to an incident referred to in article 11, paragraph 2(b), and occurring before the denunciation takes effect, shall continue to apply."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
#> [3] "27\nextraordinary sessions of the assembly\n1 any contracting state may, within ninety days after the deposit of an instrument of denunciation the result of which it considers will significantly increase the level of contributions for the remaining contracting states, request the director of the supplementary fund to convene an extraordinary session of the assembly. the director of the supplementary fund shall convene the assembly to meet not later than sixty days after receipt of the request.\n2 the director of the supplementary fund may take the initiative to convene an extraordinary session of the assembly to meet within sixty days after the deposit of any instrument of denunciation, if the director of the supplementary fund considers that such denunciation will result in a significant increase in the level of contributions of the remaining contracting states.\n3 if the assembly at an extraordinary session convened in accordance with paragraph 1 or 2 decides that the denunciation will result in a significant increase in the level of contributions for the remaining contracting states, any such state may, not later than one hundred and twenty days before the date on which the denunciation takes effect, denounce this protocol with effect from the same date."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
#> [4] "30\ndepositary\n1 this protocol and any amendments accepted under article 24 shall be deposited with the secretary-general.\n2 the secretary-general shall:\n(a) inform all states which have signed or acceded to this protocol of:\n(i) each new signature or deposit of an instrument together with the date thereof;\n(ii) the date of entry into force of this protocol;\n(iii) any proposal to amend the limit of the amount of compensation which has been made in accordance with article 24, paragraph 1;\n(iv) any amendment which has been adopted in accordance with article 24, paragraph 4;\n(v) any amendment deemed to have been accepted under article 24, paragraph 7, together with the date on which that amendment shall enter into force in accordance with paragraphs 8 and 9 of that article;\n(vi) the deposit of an instrument of denunciation of this protocol together with the date of the deposit and the date on which it takes effect;\n(vii) any communication called for by any article in this protocol;\n(b) transmit certified true copies of this protocol to all signatory states and to all states which accede to the protocol.\n3 as soon as this protocol enters into force, the text shall be transmitted by the secretary-general to the secretariat of the united nations for registration and publication in accordance with article 102 of the charter of the united nations." #>  [9] "1\nfor the purposes of this protocol:\n1 \"1992 liability convention\" means the international convention on civil liability for oil pollution damage, 1992;\n2 \"1992 fund convention\" means the international convention on the establishment of an international fund for compensation for oil pollution damage, 1992;\n3 \"1992 fund\" means the international oil pollution compensation fund, 1992, established under the 1992 fund convention;\n4 \"contracting state\" means a contracting state to this protocol, unless stated otherwise;\n5 when provisions of the 1992 fund convention are incorporated by reference into this protocol, \"fund\" in that convention means \"supplementary fund\", unless stated otherwise;\n6 \"ship\", \"person\", \"owner\", \"oil\", \"pollution damage\", \"preventive measures\" and \"incident\" have the same meaning as in article i of the 1992 liability convention;\n7 \"contributing oil\", \"unit of account\", \"ton\", \"guarantor\" and \"terminal installation\" have the same meaning as in article 1 of the 1992 fund convention, unless stated otherwise;\n8 \"established claim\" means a claim which has been recognised by the 1992 fund or been accepted as admissible by decision of a competent court binding upon the 1992 fund not subject to ordinary forms of review and which would have been fully compensated if the limit set out in article 4, paragraph 4, of the 1992 fund convention had not been applied to that incident;\n9 \"assembly\" means the assembly of the international oil pollution compensation supplementary fund, 2003, unless otherwise indicated;\n10 \"organization\" means the international maritime organization;\n11 \"secretary-general\" means the secretary-general of the organization."
#> [10] "NA"

#> [12] "1\nles gouvernements contractants conviennent de collaborer etroitement en vue de proteger contre la pollution les eaux superficielles et souterraines italo-suisses indiquees ci-apres, y compris les eaux de leurs affluents dans la mesure ou ceux-ci contribuent a polluer lesdites eaux communes:\n1. lac majeur (verbano);\n2. lac de lugano (ceresio);\n3. cours d'eau situes sur la frontiere ou traversant celle-ci, tels que: doveria, melezza, giona, tresa, breggia, maira (mera), poschiavino et spol."

#> [1] "convention entre la suisse et l'italie concernant la protection des eaux italo-suisses contre la pollution\nsource: unofficial\nle conseil federal suisse et le gouvernement italien,\ndesireux de coordonner les efforts en vue de proteger les eaux italo-suisses contre la pollution,\nsont convenus de ce qui suit:"

#> [[16]]
#> [1] "amendments to the convention on conservation of nature in the south pacific of 12 june 1976\nsource: unofficial text\nadopted at the fifth meeting of the contracting parties.\nfollowing are amendments to original text:\nin article vii, paragraph 1, and article viii, paragraph 2, replace \"south pacific commission\" with \"south pacific regional environment programme\".\nreplace text of article ix with following new text:\n\"no provision in this convention should preclude a party at the time of deposit of its instrument of ratification, acceptance, approval or accession from making a declaration consistent with the objectives of this convention and the principles of international law.\"\nrenumber existing article x as article xi and insert new article x as follows:\n\"article x\n1. amendments to this convention may be proposed by any contracting party. the text of any proposed amendment to this convention shall be communicated to the contracting parties by the body charged with the continuing bureau duties under the convention at least 90 days before the meeting at which it is proposed for adoption.\n2. the amendments shall be adopted by a three-fourths majority vote of the contracting parties present and voting at the meeting and shall be submitted by the depositary to all contracting parties for ratification, acceptance or approval.\n3. ratification, acceptance or approval of amendments shall be notified to the depositary in writing. amendments adopted in accordance with paragraph 2 above, shall enter into force between contracting parties having accepted them on the thirtieth day after the deposit of instruments of ratification, acceptance or approval by at least three-fourths of the contracting parties to this convention. thereafter the amendments shall enter into force for any other contracting party on the thirtieth day after that party deposits its instrument of ratification, acceptance or approval of the amendments.\"\nrenumber articles xi to xv as articles xii to xvi.\nin article xii (renumbered from article xi), for \"western samoa\" read \"samoa\".\nin article xiii (renumbered from article xii), replace \"the states referred to in article x\" with \"states members of the south pacific regional environment programme\"."

#> [[4]]
#> [1] "page 1| delimitation treaties infobase | accessed on 18/03/2002\n\n\n exchange of notes constituting an agreement concerning negotiations on the line of\n       maritime delimitation in the area lying between jersey and france\n                                  28 january 1994\n\nnote no: 19/94\n\nher britannic majesty's embassy presents its compliments to the ministry of foreign affairs and has the honour to refer to the\nwish of the british authorities to negotiate with the french authorities the line of maritime delimitation in the area lying between\njersey and france, taking account of the proposal to extend the territorial waters around jersey in conformity with international\nlaw. the french authorities were informed of this proposal during the meeting held on 6 january 1993 in london.\nthe british and french parties agree, fol]owing discussions between them during meetings held on 12 august 1993, 29\nnovember 1993 and 12 january 1994, on the following:\n          1.        the british and french parties will begin without delay discussions with the object of fixing a line of\nmaritime delimitation in the area lying between jersey and france.\n          2.        such a delimitation will not affect in any way the fishing regime of granville bay, as it results from all the\nvarious texts agreed on that subject at bilateral and multilateral level.\n          3.        the present note will not prejudice the positions expressed orally and in writing by each party on the\nquestions raised during the meetings mentioned above.\n\nher britannic majesty's embassy avails itself of this opportunity to renew to the ministry of foreign affairs the assurance of its\nhighest consideration.\n\nbritish embassy\nparis\n28 january 1994\n\n\n\n\ndoalos/ola - united nations"

#> [1] "NA"

#> [[7]]

#> [[10]]
#> [1] "NA"
#> 
#> [[11]]
#> [1] "NA"
#> 
#> [[12]]
#>  [1] "convention entre la suisse et l'italie concernant la protection des eaux italo-suisses contre la pollution\nsource: unofficial\nle conseil federal suisse et le gouvernement italien,\ndesireux de coordonner les efforts en vue de proteger les eaux italo-suisses contre la pollution,\nsont convenus de ce qui suit:"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
#>  [2] "1\nles gouvernements contractants conviennent de collaborer etroitement en vue de proteger contre la pollution les eaux superficielles et souterraines italo-suisses indiquees ci-apres, y compris les eaux de leurs affluents dans la mesure ou ceux-ci contribuent a polluer lesdites eaux communes:\n1. lac majeur (verbano);\n2. lac de lugano (ceresio);\n3. cours d'eau situes sur la frontiere ou traversant celle-ci, tels que: doveria, melezza, giona, tresa, breggia, maira (mera), poschiavino et spol."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
#>  [3] "2\nles gouvernements contractants constituent une commission mixte pour la protection des eaux italo-suisses contre la pollution, denommee ci-apres <<la commission>>."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
#>  [4] "3\nla commission a les attributions suivantes:\na) elle examine tous les problemes qui sont en rapport avec la pollution ou toute autre alteration des eaux italo-suisses.\nb) elle organise et fait effectuer toutes les recherches necessaires pour determiner l'origine, la nature et l'importance des pollutions et elle exploite les resultats de ces recherches.\nc) elle elabore chaque annee, pour les travaux de recherches mentionnes sous lettre b ci-dessus, un plan financier a soumettre a l'approbation des gouvernements respectifs.\nd) elle propose aux gouvernements contractants les mesures a prendre pour remedier a la pollution existante et prevenir toute pollution future.\ne) elle propose aux gouvernements contractants un projet de reglementation propre a assurer la salubrite des eaux italo-suisses."
#>  [5] "4\n1. la commission est composee de deux delegations, chacune etant nommee par son gouvernement respectif.\n2. chaque delegation comprend un nombre egal de membres, de six au maximum, dont l'un est chef de delegation.\n3. pour l'etude des problemes scientifiques et techniques, la commission est assistee d'une sous-commission dont les membres, nommes par elle, sont designes par les delegations respectives."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
#>  [6] "5\nla commission se reunit au moins une fois par an sur la convocation de son president."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
#>  [7] "6\nla presidence de la commission est assumee a tour de role pour une periode de deux ans par le chef de l'une des delegations."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
#>  [8] "7\n1. les decisions de la commission sont prises d'un commun accord entre les deux delegations.\n2. la commission etablit son reglement interieur."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
#>  [9] "8\nles gouvernements contractants examinent les propositions de la commission et decident des conditions dans lesquelles les mesures d'execution necessaires peuvent etre prises."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
#> [10] "9\n1. chacun des gouvernements contractants assume les frais de sa delegation a la commission et des experts qu'il designe pour les travaux de la sous-commission.\n2. les frais relatifs aux travaux de recherches prevus a l'article 3, lettre b), seront repartis selon des criteres fixes d'un commun accord par les deux gouvernements sur proposition de la commission.\n3. toute autre depense eventuelle qui ne peut etre repartie sur la base de l'alinea precedent le sera selon des modalites a etablir de cas en cas par la commission."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
#> [11] "10\nen vue d'une meilleure information scientifique et technique, la commission pourra prendre contact, si elle le juge necessaire, avec les organismes internationaux traitant de la protection des eaux, de meme qu'avec les commissions ou organismes italo-suisses s'occupant de la navigation, de la peche, de la regularisation des eaux et de la gestion des eaux en general."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
#> [12] "11\nla presente convention entrera en vigueur lorsque chacun des gouvernements contractants aura notifie a l'autre l'accomplissement de la procedure prevue a cette fin par son ordre juridique. des l'expiration d'un delai de trois ans apres son entree en vigueur, la convention pourra etre denoncee en tout temps, par chacun des gouvernements contractants, selon un preavis de six mois.\nfait a rome, le 20 avril 1972, en deux originaux en langue italienne.\npour le conseil federal suisse: pour le gouvernement italien:\n2 ro 1973 1399"

#> [1] "c(\"                                                 agreement #2\\n                                            terms of reference for\\n                                          monitoring and datn sharing\\n\\n    for sustainable development and proper management of the nubian sandstone aquifer system, continious\\n    monitoring of the aquifer should be maintained. in order to observe the regional behavior of the nsas,\\n    monitored parameters of the aquifer should be shared between the concerned countries.\\n\\n    hence, it is herewith agreed between the four countries sharing the nubian sandstone aquifer system,\\n    namely chad, egypt, libya and sudan, represented by their national coordinators to monitor and share\\n    among them the following information:\\n\\n            yearly extraction in every extraction site, specifying geographical location and number of\\n    producing wells and springs in each site.\\n\\n             representative electrical conductivity measurements (ec), taken once a year in each\\n    extraction site, followed by a complete chemical analysis if drastic changes in salinity is observed.\\n\\ns           water level measurements taken twice a year in the locations shown in the attached maps\\n    and tables. the proposed monitoring nehvork is subject to changes upon the feedback of the\\n    national coordinators of the concerned countries.\\n\\n    these measurements should be undertaken within the nubian aquifer system and the post nubian aquifer\\n    system.\\n\\n    dr. o m a r salern #> [1] "c(\"page 1| delimitation treaties infobase | accessed on 13/03/2002\\n\\n\\n     treaty between the kingdom of denmark and the federal republic of germany\\n       concerning the delimitation of the continental shelf under the north sea\\n                                  (28 january 1971)\\n\\n          the kingdom of denmark and the federal republic of germany, desiring to delimit their respective parts of the\\ncontinental shelf under the north sea in so far as that was not previously done by the treaty of 9 june 1965 concerning the\\ndelimitation, in the coastal regions, of the continental shelf of the north sea,\\n          desiring to regulate the economic utilization of the continental shelf in so far as that is in their mutual interest,\\n          on the basis of the judgment of the international court of justice of 20 february 1969 in the north sea continental\\nshelf case between the kingdom of denmark and the kingdom of netherlands, of the one part, and the federal republic of\\ngermany, of the other part,\\n          having regard to those boundaries of the continental shelf which are not affected by the judgment of the international\\ncourt of justice,\\n          have agreed as follows:\\n\\n                                                              article 1\\n\\n          (1)       the boundary between the danish and german parts of the continental shelf under the north sea shall extend\\nfrom the end of the partial boundary established by the treaty of 9 june 1965, in arcs of great circles between the following\\npoints:\\n\\nsl        55° 10' 03.4\\\" n    07° 33' 09.6\\\" e\\ns2        55° 30' 40.3\\\" n    05° 45' 00.0\\\" e\\ns3        55° 15' 00.0\\\" n    05° 24' 12.0\\\" e\\ns4        55° 15' 00.0\\\" n    05° 09' 00.0\\\" e\\ns5        55° 24' 15.0\\\" n    04° 45' 00.0\\\" e\\ns6        55° 46' 21.8\\\" n    04° 15' 00.0\\\" e\\ns7        55° 55' 09.4\\\" n    03° 21' 00.0\\\" e\\n\\n          the positions of the points are defined by latitude and longitude according to the european datum (first adjustment\\n1950).\\n          (2)       the boundary termination point s7 is the point of intersection of the boundaries of the danish, german and\\nunited kingdom parts of the continental shelf under the north sea.\\n        (3)      the boundary and the partial boundary established by the treaty of 9 june 1965 are shown on the chart forming\\nannex 1 of this treaty.\\n\\n                                                              article 2\\n\\n            (1)      if the existence of a mineral deposit in or on the continental shelf of one of the contracting parties is\\nestablished and the other contracting party is of the opinion that the said mineral deposit extends into its continental shelf, the\\nlatter contracting party may notify the former contracting party accordingly, at the same time submitting the data on which it\\nbases its opinion. if the former contracting party does not share the opinion of the other contracting party, the arbitral tribunal\\nshall in accordance with article 5, at the request of either contracting party, make a ruling on the question.\\n\\n          (2)       if the contracting parties agree on the question or if the arbitral tribunal rules that the mineral deposit extends\\n\\n\\ndoalos/ola - united nations\\n\", \n\"page 2| delimitation treaties infobase | accessed on 13/03/2002\\ninto or onto the continental shelf of both contracting parties, the government of the contracting parties shall, for the purpose of\\nexploitation, agree upon regulations which, with due regard for the interests of both contracting parties, take into account the\\nprinciple that each contracting party has title to the mineral resources situated in or on its continental shelf. if any mineral\\nresources have previously been extracted from the deposit extending across the boundary, the regulations shall also include\\nprovisions for reasonable compensation.\\n\\n           (3)      regulations pursuant to paragraph (2) may also, with the consent of the governments of the contracting\\nparties, be agreed upon wholly or partly between the entitled parties. an entitled party is any person who has a right to extract\\nthe mineral resources in question.\\n\\n            (4)      if regulations pursuant to paragraph (2) or paragraph (3) above have not been drawn up within a reasonable\\ntime, either contracting party may bring the matter before the arbitral tribunal in accordance with article 5. in such cases, the\\narbitral tribunal may also make a ruling ex aequo et bono. the arbitral tribunal shall be empowered to issue interim orders, after\\nhearing the contracting parties.\\n\\n                                                             article 3\\n\\n        without prejudice to the rules of international law relating to the laying of pipelines on the continental shelf, any\\npipelines laid on the continental shelf in connexion with the extraction of mineral resources shall, with a view to the prevention of\\nmarine pollution and other hazards, be subject to the provisions in force with regard to the construction and use of pipelines of\\nthe contracting party across whose continental shelf such pipelines are laid.\\n\\n                                                             article 4\\n\\n (1) the enterprises referred to in annex 2 of this treaty shall, upon application, be granted licences under german law to\\nexplore for and extract petroleum and natural gas as well as any other substances obtained in the course of such extraction, in the\\nareas specified in the said annex.\\n\\n          (2)      applications for the licences referred to in paragraph (1) must be submitted to the competent german\\nauthority within one year from the date of the entry into force of this treaty.\\n\\n                                                             article 5\\n\\n         (1)      disputes between the contracting parties concerning the interpretation or application of this treaty or of any\\nregulations agreed upon pursuant to article 2, paragraph (2), shall as far as possible be settled by negotiation.\\n         (2)      any dispute not settled in this manner within a reasonable time shall, at the request of either contracting party,\\nbe referred to an arbitral tribunal for decision.\\n         (3)      the arbitral tribunal shall be constituted on an ad hoc basis. save where the contracting parties, by way of a\\nsimplified procedure, agree to appoint a single arbitrator to settle the dispute, an arbitral tribunal of three members shall be\\nconstituted in the following manner: each contracting party shall appoint one member, and the two members shall agree on a\\nnational of a third state, who shall be appointed chairman by the two contracting parties. the members must be appointed\\nwithin two months, and the chairman within a further two months, after a request by either contracting party for settlement of the\\ndispute by an arbitral tribunal.\\n         (4)      if the time-limits specified in paragraph (3) are not met, either contracting party may request the president of the\\ninternational court of justice to make the necessary appointments. if the president is a national of one of the contracting parties\\nor is incapacitated for any other reason, the appointments shall be made by the vice-president. if the vice-president also is a\\nnational of one of the contracting parties or is incapacitated, the appointments shall be made by the next most senior member of\\nthe court who is not a national of one of the contracting parties and is not incapacitated.\\n\\ndoalos/ola - united nations\\n\", \n\"page 3| delimitation treaties infobase | accessed on 13/03/2002\\n         (5)      the arbitral tribunal shall take its decisions by majority vote. each contracting party shall bear the costs of its\\nmember and of its representation in the case before the tribunal; the costs of the chairman and any other costs shall be borne by\\nthe contracting parties equally.\\n         (6)      the arbitral tribunal or the single arbitrator shall reach a decision on the basis of the international law applicable\\nbetween the contracting parties. the decision shall be binding.\\n         (7)      the arbitral tribunal or the single arbitrator shall determine its or his own procedure, save as otherwise provided\\nin this treaty or by the contracting parties when the arbitral tribunal or the single arbitrator is appointed.\\n\\n                                                               article 6\\n\\n         articles 2 and 3, and article 5 in so far as it relates to the settlement of disputes concerning the interpretation or\\napplication of articles 2 and 3, shall apply mutatis mutandis to the area of the continental shelf in the vicinity of the coast which\\nwas delimited by the treaty of 9 june 1965.\\n\\n                                                               article 7\\n\\n         this treaty shall also apply to land berling, provided that the government of the federal republic of germany has not\\nmade a declaration to the contrary to the government of the kingdom of denmark within three months from the date of the entry\\ninto force of the treaty.\\n\\n                                                               article 8\\n\\n        (1) this treaty shall be ratified. the instruments of ratification shall be exchanged at bonn.\\n        (2)     the treaty shall enter into force one month after the exchange of the instruments of ratification.\\n        done at copenhagen on 28 january 1971, in duplicate in the danish and german languages, both texts being equally\\nauthentic.\\n\\n\\n                                                            annex 2\\n                                                          (ad article 4)\\n       (1)     enterprises: dansk boreselskab aktieselskab, aktieselskabet dampskibsselskabet svendborg and\\ndampskibsselskabet af 1912 aktieselskab individually or collectively, or a subsidiary of one or more of the above-mentioned\\ncompanies constituted under danish or german law at the time of application.\\n       (2)     licence area: the area enclosed by arcs of great circles between the following points:\\n\\n55° 15' 00.0\\\" n    05° 24' 12.0\\\" e\\n55° 15' 00.0\\\" n    05° 09' 00.0\\\" e\\n55° 24' 15.0\\\" n    04° 45' 00.0\\\" e\\n55° 20' 55.1\\\" n    04° 40' 00.0\\\" e\\n55° 07' 56.2\\\" n    05° 15' 00.0\\\" e\\n\\n         the positions of the points are defined by latitude and longitude according to the european datum (first adjustment\\n1950).\\n\\n\\n                                                     exchange of letters\\n\\n\\n\\ndoalos/ola - united nations\\n\", \n\"page 4| delimitation treaties infobase | accessed on 13/03/2002\\n                                                                 i\\n\\n\\nthe ambassador of the federal republic of germany\\ncopenhagen, 28 january 1971\\n\\nsir,\\n\\n           i have the honour to state, in connexion with the signing this day of the treaty between the federal republic of\\ngermany and the kingdom of denmark concerning the delimitation of the continental shelf under the north sea, that our two\\ngovernments have agreed that, pending ratification of the treaty, legal relations in respect of the area of the continental shelf\\nunder the north sea which the kingdom of denmark has hitherto considered to be danish property but which in accordance with\\nthis treaty is the property of the federal republic of germany shall, as from today until the date of the entry into force of the\\ntreaty, be regulated as follows:\\n           in the case of the area in question, the government of the kingdom of denmark shall, in accordance with the desire of\\nthe federal republic of germany that its rights in the area should not be abridged:\\n           (a)       refrain from renewing expired licences and from issuing new licences;\\n           (b)       refrain from approving, except with the consent of the government of the federal republic of germany, any\\nplans for exploration or exploitation of the continental shelf which require a licence under danish law;\\n           (c)       notify the government of the federal republic of germany of any other plans for exploration or exploitation\\nof the continental shelf which may come to the notice of the government of the kingdom of denmark.\\n           i should be grateful if you would confirm to me that your government agrees with the foregoing arrangement.\\n\\n\\n                                                                ii\\n\\n\\nforeign ministry\\ncopenhagen, 28 january 1971\\n\\nsir,\\n\\n        i have the honour to acknowledge receipt of your letter of today's date, the text of which in danish reads as follows:\\n[see note i]\\n        i have the honour to confirm to you that my government agrees with the contents of your letter.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\ndoalos/ola - united nations\\n\"\n)"
